items.title: UNESCO Moves to Protect Odesa, Designating the City a World Heritage Site
items.abstract: The Black Sea port has been battered by Russian shelling for months.
keywords: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization

items.title: A Bruised San Bernardino Shows Cultural Stirrings
items.abstract: A poet and a photographer, both professors, are helping to lead efforts to reinvigorate and redefine the city through the arts.

items.title: New York City to Help Fund Internships at Cultural Organizations
items.abstract: The Department of Cultural Affairs has launched an initiative to place CUNY students at paid internships at Carnegie Hall and other institutions.

items.title: Cultural Cringe and ‘The Lost City of Melbourne’
items.abstract: A new documentary goes some way to explaining why the city looks the way it does.

items.title: New York City ID Cards Coming With Cultural Benefits
items.abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio announced that new identification cards will arrive with a bonus: offers of free admission or discounts at 33 of the city’s leading cultural institutions.
